p: In the period of 2002–2019, phytochemical studies have identified a total of 86 natural compounds from leaves and flower buds of S. nervosum. The main components of S. nervosum were determined as oleanane-and ursane-type triterpenoids [ 7], C-methylated flavonoids [ 8], and polycyclic phloroglucinols [ 9, 10]. Of these, C-methylated chalcones were considered as major and pharmacologically responsible constituents of this medicinal plant. S. nervosum crude extract and its major constituent, 2′, 4′-dihydroxy-6′-methoxy-3′, 5′-dimethylchalcone (or DMC), were also examined in a variety of pharmacological assays. To a certain extent, some pharmacological effects explained the medicinal uses of this plant in folklore medicine, such as antiviral [ 8, 11], anti-inflammatory [ 12], and antioxidant activities [ 13, 14]. Furthermore, other interesting bioactivities were also discovered, such as anticancer [ 15– 19] and antidiabetic [ 20, 21] properties, which greatly contributed to the potential clinical application of this plant.
